thread.title: Blue Jays, Royals come out firing hard
thread.title_full: Blue Jays, Royals come out firing hard - KCTV5

author: DeAnn Smith, Digital Content Manager
title: Blue Jays, Royals come out firing hard
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Edinson Volquez came out throwing hard with one pitch reaching 97 mph, which is several ticks higher than normal.
It took nearly 25 pitches but Volquez came out of the first inning with no damage.
Alcides Escobar led off with a standoff double off Blue Jays pitcher Marco Estrada.
Royals manager Ned Yost is using the same roster for the ALCS that won the Royals the ALDS.
Speedster Terrance Gore can again change the game by coming into the late innings as a pinch runner. Jonny Gomes who the Royals traded for this summer will remain on the bench as an inspirational cheerleader.
Gore hadn't been caught stealing in the big leagues until Monday's game against the Astros, and that took a controversial official review.
The umpires are Tony Randazzo, Laz Diaz, John Hirschbeck, who is the crew chief, Hunter Wendelstedt, Dan Iassogna, Jeff Nelson and Jim Reynolds.
Diaz was attacked by a fan when the Royals played the White Sox in Chicago in 2003.
The national anthem was performed by saxophonist Michael Phillips. He has performed on a previous Opening Day for the Royals.
The Canadian anthem was performed by Tina Maddigan-Mayer, a Canadian who has performed on Broadway in the Wedding Singer and Mamma Mia.
We want to send your photos. Email them to yourphotos@kctv5.com or post them on Twitter with the hashtag #CrownCrazy.
